page.title: 09B.M.X.Bikes
page.content:
A popular craze of 1985 for young people, is B.M.X. bikes. This stands for British Motor Cross. A good model costs Â£250, but there are cheaper models in all three types. They race on tracks and are used for freestyle stunts. The most common stunt is the "wheelie" where the front Wheel is raised off the ground and the bike is ridden only on the rear wheel. Other stunts include jumps like the "double whoops" and the "King Kong". Because of the danger involved in these stunts, crash helmets and arm and leg pads are worn.
James Scrimshaw
